item.description:
Free and open to the public. We will divide our time between generative writing exercises provided by a facilitator, and workshop sessions for writers seeking revision suggestions. To participate, RSVP so we know how many people to expect (we will cap the group at 10), and, if receiving feedback, email work in advance to the group.

When: every other Monday night, 7-9 pm (next meeting, Mon. April 15)
Where: Doyle’s Café (Jamaica Plain)
About the moderators:
Rachel Becker has an M.Phil in Early English literature and is a published poet and fiction writer whose work has appeared in The Exquisite Corpse (ed. Andrei Codrescu), and Notes from Underground: A Literary Lab Anthology. She teaches English and writing in Newton.

Celeste Bocchicchio-Chaudhri is a writer, artist, and milliner. Her writing has been included in chapbooks produced by the Poet's League of Greater Cleveland. She has collaborated on and contributed to many zines including zine Galatea's Pants, Seeking the Lotus, and Our Country: The Vagina Monologues Zine.
item.name: JP/Rozzie Bi-Monthly Writing Workshop
